decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly generate mana while cycling through the deck to find combo pieces and eventually cast a lethal Grapeshot spell. It utilizes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Ruby Medallion to reduce the cost of spells, while also making use of Past in Flames to recast spells from the graveyard. The deck includes cantrips like Manamorphose and Reckless Impulse to dig for key pieces, with Wish acting as a versatile toolbox spell. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to accelerate mana production and enable powerful combo plays with Primeval Titan. By ramping quickly, the deck can search for key pieces such as Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige to further enhance its capabilities. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Malevolent Rumble and Green Sun's Zenith provide additional versatility and utility. The deck aims to quickly assemble its key pieces and overwhelm opponents with its explosive combos and powerful creatures, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of speed and strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to further chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck aims to have a fast and aggressive start, using cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to push through any blockers. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration helps maintain card advantage and ensure consistent draws. Overall, the deck's main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells to outvalue the opponent. With the UrzaTron lands, this deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana to cast big threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator. By combining disruption with powerful threats like Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Devourer of Destiny, this deck can quickly take over the game and overpower the opponent. With a mix of control elements and high-impact threats, this deck aims to dominate the game in the mid to late game stages.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using cards like Ephemerate and Goryo's Vengeance. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Psychic Frog are key combo pieces that can help control the board while setting up the reanimation engine. The deck also uses cards like Solitude and Force of Negation to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. With a mix of control elements and powerful reanimation effects, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with unexpected threats and generate value from the graveyard.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. The deck also includes board control cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats on the opponent's side. The use of cards like Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker allows for card advantage and flexibility in different situations. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a strong board presence through artifact creatures and utilizing support cards to enhance their abilities. By generating a large number of +1/+1 counters and sacrificing artifacts, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful, aggressive creatures. The deck also includes disruption elements to control the opponent's strategy and protect its own creatures. Additionally, the deck incorporates land and artifact synergy to maximize efficiency and consistency in executing its aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp up and cast big Eldrazi creatures and game-changing spells. It combines control elements with powerful threats like Devourer of Destiny and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence. The deck's main win conditions are Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms, which can provide value and generate advantage. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging the mana advantage from UrzaTron lands, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This aggro deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures with efficient removal spells and Leyline cards to control the board and deal consistent damage to the opponent. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a mix of low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, while also utilizing powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding helps to protect creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while Tribal Flames adds additional reach for closing out games.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence using low-cost artifacts and efficient creatures to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Springleaf Drum, the deck can quickly generate mana and fuel for cards like Cranial Plating and Thought Monitor to deal massive damage to the opponent. The inclusion of Urza's Saga provides additional value by searching for key artifacts, while cards like Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor provide disruption to control the pace of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the Broodscale Bloodchief combo, which involves using various creatures and artifacts to generate mana and control the board. By utilizing cards like Kozilek's Command, Ancient Stirrings, and Malevolent Rumble, the player can set up the combo pieces while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Emrakul, the Promised End provides additional threats and disruption. With the support of Urza's Saga and other lands, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish.

This Dimir control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining card advantage and controlling the pace of the game. The deck includes a variety of counter spells, discard effects, and removal spells to keep the opponent on the back foot. Additionally, the inclusion of card draw effects and powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares allows the deck to close out games efficiently once the opponent has been sufficiently slowed down and stripped of resources.

The deck focuses on using instant reanimate cards like Goryo's Vengeance to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand quickly, while also utilizing cards like Solitude and Psychic Frog to control the board. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to support the combo pieces by reducing their cost. Quantum Riddler provides a unique win condition through milling. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. The mana base is designed to support the various colors needed for the deck's spells and abilities.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan using cheap removal spells and hand disruption like Thoughtseize. The deck aims to deploy threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Nethergoyf quickly to apply pressure and win the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the deck utilizes graveyard synergy with cards like Cling to Dust and Graveyard Trespasser to gain advantage and close out games efficiently.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful spells and planeswalkers. By utilizing counterspells, removal, and card draw effects, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan and disrupt their strategies. With a mix of efficient creatures, board wipes, and versatile utility lands, this deck has the tools to handle a variety of threats while maintaining card advantage and staying ahead in the game. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional value and synergy with the deck's creature base.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It utilizes a mix of instant-speed interaction and card advantage to outlast the opponent and eventually win the game. The inclusion of the companion Kaheera adds flexibility and resilience to the deck's game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for access to a variety of colors to support the control strategy effectively. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a slow, methodical manner.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively play powerful creatures such as Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes control elements like Stubborn Denial and Leyline Binding to disrupt the opponent's strategies. The mana base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells, with Leyline of the Guildpact to help with color requirements. Arena of Glory provides additional support for the creatures, creating a fast-paced and aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It utilizes a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. The inclusion of Leylines and Leyline Binding helps protect the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes some counter spells and card draw to provide flexibility and resilience. Overall, the key concept is to maintain pressure and control the game tempo while dealing consistent damage to the opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures with a mix of colors to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It utilizes efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt to control the board. The deck also includes Leyline cards to protect its creatures and Leyline Binding to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base includes fetch lands and a variety of shock lands to ensure consistent access to all colors. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain board presence to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures and using efficient removal and protection spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. By utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Territorial Kavu alongside powerful spells like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early and finish the game before they can recover. The addition of Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provides additional support for the deck's game plan, while the land base ensures consistency in mana production.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to quickly get out lands like Simic Growth Chamber and Lotus Field to generate large amounts of mana. Amulet of Vigor helps to untap the lands, while cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift allow for quick ramping and fetching of key lands or combo pieces. The deck aims to assemble the Amulet Titan combo quickly to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and lands, ultimately leading to a winning board state.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cheat out big threats like Primeval Titan. The goal is to use these powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through a combination of land-related triggers and efficient combos. The deck also makes use of utility lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to further enhance its strategy and ensure its success. Ultimately, it is a deck that aims to achieve a quick and explosive victory through careful planning and execution.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of cards to quickly bring powerful creatures back from the graveyard onto the battlefield, creating a strong advantage. By using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate along with creatures like Atraxa and Griselbrand, the deck can create explosive plays and overwhelm opponents. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect its combos and control the game. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck's spells while also providing flexibility for fetching with cards like Marsh Flats and Polluted Delta.

The deck focuses on leveraging instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to quickly put powerful creatures like Griselbrand into play. This combo strategy is complemented by cards like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to enable consistent reanimation and card advantage. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' game plans. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in executing the combo strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly putting Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play by using instant reanimation spells such as Goryo's Vengeance. By combining this with cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate, the deck can quickly fill up the graveyard with key creatures like Griselbrand. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. Prismatic Ending provides versatile removal options. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements while also including utility lands like Meticulous Archive and Undercity Sewers.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a lot of artifacts to take advantage of the Affinity mechanic, allowing for explosive starts and overwhelming opponents with a wide board presence. By using cards like Memnite, Ornithopter, and Mishra's Bauble along with mana accelerants like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, the deck aims to flood the board with threats early on. With disruptive cards like Metallic Rebuke and Tormod's Crypt, as well as card draw options like Thoughtcast, the deck looks to maintain pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan while pushing for a fast victory.

The main focus of this deck is to mill the opponent's library as quickly as possible using cards like Hedron Crab, Ruin Crab, Tasha's Hideous Laughter, Fractured Sanity, and Archive Trap. The goal is to rapidly reduce the opponent's deck size in order to win the game by forcing them to draw from an empty library. The deck also includes control elements like Ensnaring Bridge, Fatal Push, and Drown in the Loch to protect against aggressive strategies while maintaining the mill plan. The mana base supports the strategy with lands that can enable mill effects or provide necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while utilizing cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage and help filter through the deck for critical pieces. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and tempo to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory in the Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively attack the opponent with cheap and efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Spell Pierce. By combining burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth, the deck can push through damage and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells to maintain consistency and find key pieces to secure victory.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear while maintaining aggressive pressure with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage to keep the pressure up. The deck aims to control the board early on and finish off opponents with fast, evasive creatures and direct damage spells. The mana base is optimized for efficient casting of spells and ensuring a consistent flow of spells throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful colorless creatures and control spells in combination with the UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp up mana production and overwhelm the opponent with threats. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Kozilek's Command while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Karn and Ugin for additional advantage. The deck aims to overpower the opponent through a combination of efficient removal, disruption, and powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of powerful Eldrazi creatures and spells. By using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny to disrupt the opponent's strategy, combined with removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and maintain board control. The deck also aims to efficiently assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to ramp into big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms.
